2.text: Forget not hospitality: for by this some knew not having treated angels with friendship.

3.text: Remember them in bonds as bound together with them; them treated ill, as the same being in the body.

4.text: Marriage honoured in all, and the bed unpolluted: but fornicators and adulterers God will judge.

5.text: The disposition exempt from avarice; being contented with present circumstances: for he has said, I will not send thee back, nor forsake thee.

6.text: So that being confident, we say, The Lord aiding me, and I will not fear what man will do to me.

7.text: Remember them guiding you, who spake to you the word of God: of whom, observing narrowly the issue of the mode of life, imitate the faith:

8.text: Jesus Christ, yesterday, and to day the same, and for ever.

9.text: With various and strange teachings be not carried about. For good the heart be rendered firm by grace; not by food, in which they having walked about were not profited.

10.text: We have an altar, of which they serving the tent have no power to eat.

11.text: For of whom the blood of the living ones is brought for sin into the holies by the chief priest, the bodies of these are burned without the camp.

12.text: Wherefore also Jesus, that he might consecrate the people by his own blood, suffered without the camp.

13.text: Therefore we should come to him without the camp, bearing his reproach.

14.text: For here have we no abiding city, but we seek that about to be.

15.text: By him therefore we should always bring up the sacrifice of praise to God, that is, the fruit of the lips assenting to his name.

16.text: And the doing good and mutual participation forget not; for with such sacrifices God is well pleased.

17.text: Believe them guiding you, and yield: (for they watch vigilantly for your souls, as going to return the word.) that with joy they might do this, and not lamenting: for this unprofitable for you.

18.text: Pray for us: for we have trusted that we have a good consciousness, in all things wishing to be well occupied.

19.text: And I beseech the more abundantly to do this, that I might the more speedily be restored to you.

20.text: And the God of peace, having brought up from the dead, the great Shepherd of the sheep, in the blood of the eternal covenant, our Lord Jesus Christ,

21.text: Put you in proper order in every good work for doing his will, doing in you the thing pleasing before him, by Jesus Christ; to whom glory for the time of times. Amen.

22.text: And I beseech you, brethren, hold up the word of entreaty: for I also sent to you in a few words.

23.text: Ye know the brother Timothy having been set at liberty; with whom, if he come more speedily, I shall see you.

24.text: Greet all them guiding you, and all the holy.

25.text: They from Italy greet you. Grace with you all. Amen.
